text.content:
The Garou are shapeshifters born of flesh and spirit, warriors created to defend the living world from annihilation. To the common folk they are myths, monsters, or half-remembered nightmares. To spirits, they are both champions and failures. To themselves, the Garou are a dying people locked in an endless war they were never meant to win alone.

A Garou is not simply a werewolf. They are heirs to an ancient duty, bound by blood, Rage, and sacred law.

Children of Two Worlds

Each Garou is born with one foot in the material world and one in the spirit realms. They can see, speak with, and battle spirits that mortals never know exist. This connection grants them great power—but also burdens them with truths that cannot be ignored.

The Garou believe the world is shaped by three primordial forces:

  • The Weaver, embodiment of order, structure, and stasis

  • The Wyld, embodiment of chaos, creation, and change

  • The Wyrm, once a force of balance, now a force of corruption and destruction

The Garou were created to keep these forces in balance. They failed.

Warriors of Gaia

Gaia, the living spirit of the world, is revered as the Garou’s mother and creator. Every Garou is taught that they are Gaia’s last defenders, chosen to fight back the rot consuming the world.

This duty is not symbolic. It is violent, bloody, and unforgiving.

Garou are born into war:

  • War against corrupt spirits

  • War against monsters and abominations

  • War against secret enemies wearing human faces

  • War against their own Rage

There is no retirement from this war. There is only survival, honor, or death.

The Curse of Rage

What truly defines a Garou is Rage.

Rage is primal fury made manifest—an echo of Gaia’s pain and wrath. It fuels the Garou’s strength, speed, and ferocity, but it also threatens to consume them. When Rage overwhelms reason, the Garou becomes a danger to allies and enemies alike.

Through Rage, Garou can become legends.
Through Rage, Garou can become monsters.

Learning when to unleash it—and when to restrain it—is one of the greatest trials of Garou existence.

A Dying People

Despite their power, the Garou are losing.

Their numbers dwindle with every generation. Ancient caerns fall. Old alliances fracture. Many Garou die young, violently, and forgotten. Others cling to traditions that no longer fit the world as it is now.

Yet they fight on.

Not because victory is certain—but because surrender would mean the death of everything they were born to protect.

What the World Sees

To mortals, Garou are:

  • Urban legends

  • Serial killers

  • Wild beasts

  • Demons or devils

The Garou call this ignorance the Veil, and they guard it fiercely. If humanity ever truly learned the truth, the world would burn faster than it already does.

What the Garou Believe

Among themselves, the Garou know the truth:

They are not heroes.
They are not saviors.
They are weapons—old, flawed, and still swinging.

And as long as the world still draws breath, the Garou will answer its call.
